00024 struct treestruct {
00025                 int n;
00026                 double * time;
00027                 double * trait;
00028                 int * state;    // regime indicator for each node
00029                 int * ancestor; // sufficent to define the tree topology
00030 
00031                 // For convenience/speed, can be computed from ancestor vector 
00032                 int * left;     
00033                 int * right;    
00034                 int * tip;              
00035 
00036                 int nstates;    // number of regimes
00037                 
00038                 int npars;              
00039                 double * pars;
00040                 int * fitpar;
00041                 int nfreepars;
00042                 double (* eqn)(int n1, int n2, struct treestruct * mytree);
00043 
00044 };

00082 typedef struct {
00083         size_t n;
00084         size_t gridsize;
00085         // we'll need a matrix (list) for each node, hence the pointer pointer
00086         double ** matrix;
00087         // each node must also keep track of the product underneath it
00088         double ** sofar;
00089 
00090         // we'll reuse these product vectors for each node
00091         double * product;
00092         double * grid;
00093 } matrices;
